intro: Anagallis arvensis var. carnea, commonly known as the red-flowered mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of bright red, five-petaled flowers. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. The flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
